svg.text: title: "December 28, 2018" date: "2018-12-28"

Application layer

* Eth gaming pioneer Etherplay is exploring “blockchain game economies minted by
central servers”
Eth gaming pioneer Etherplay is exploring “blockchain game economies minted by central
servers”
* Cryptowars (running on Loom) has a tournament going live this week
Cryptowars (running on Loom) has a tournament going live this week
* Loopring v2 is live.
Loopring v2 is live.
* Brave does a hotfix around clearly showing who is a verified publisher . Whiners kept
whining in possibly the dumbest complaint ever - they’re upset that BAT can accumulate
for a publisher who hasn’t yet verified.
Brave does a hotfix around clearly showing who is a verified publisher . Whiners kept
* Lympo and the Dallas Mavs have a fitness incentive program using a token on Ethereum
and lets you buy Mavs merchandise with it.
Lympo and the Dallas Mavs have a fitness incentive program using a token on Ethereum
* Unikrn launches esports betting platform
Unikrn launches esports betting platform
* In response to lawsuit threats from BNY Mellon , Melonport is now waterMelonport. The
water may be silent.
In response to lawsuit threats from BNY Mellon , Melonport is now waterMelonport. The

General
* Ledger responds to the hardware wallet attack talk at 35c3. They’re underwhelmed.

world. Yuck.

* An intro to the Radical Markets ideas

* No surprise that in crypto winter Wall Street’s crypto projects are on hold . Which
is great, because then the true believers are better positioned in future competition
No surprise that in crypto winter Wall Street’s crypto projects are on hold . Which is
great, because then the true believers are better positioned in future competition
* Somehow I’d missed the return of Merry Merkle doing renovation work in a South
African high school. Also, Unicef France now accepts Dai

high school. Also, Unicef France now accepts Dai
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note ( new in bold ):
* Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
* Jan 10-Feb7 - 0x and Coinlist virtual hackathon
Jan 10-Feb7 - 0x and Coinlist virtual hackathon
* Jan ~15 - Constantinople hard fork at block 7080000
Jan ~15 - Constantinople hard fork at block 7080000
* Jan 17 - Aragon vote on funding original AragonOne team
Jan 17 - Aragon vote on funding original AragonOne team
* Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
* Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
* Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
* Feb 23-25 - EthAustin (EthUniversal)
Feb 23-25 - EthAustin (EthUniversal)
* Mar 4 - Ethereum Magicians (Paris)
Mar 4 - Ethereum Magicians (Paris)
* Mar 5-7 - EthCC (Paris)
Mar 5-7 - EthCC (Paris)
* Mar 8-10 - ETHParis (ETHGlobal)
Mar 8-10 - ETHParis (ETHGlobal)
* Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
Mar 27 - Infura end of legacy key support (Jan 23 begins Project ID prioritization)
* April 8-14 - Edcon hackathon and conference (Sydney)
April 8-14 - Edcon hackathon and conference (Sydney)
* Apr 19-21 - ETHCapetown (ETHGlobal)
Apr 19-21 - ETHCapetown (ETHGlobal)
* May 10-11 - Ethereal (NYC)
May 10-11 - Ethereal (NYC)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys .
I own Week In Ethereum. Editorial control has always been 100% me.
If you’re unhappy with editorial decisions or anything that I have written in this
issue, feel free to tweet at me .
What about this newsletter sucks?
What about this newsletter sucks and you wish I would fix? Repeated and bolded for
emphasis.
Here are various things I hear: 1) you didn’t include X, Y, and Z this week vs the
newsletter is too long now, 2) the category labels suck (I agree with this, but finding
preferred categories has been harder than I thought), 3) you didn’t have some random
local event in city C, 4) too much non-Eth vs if there was more non-Eth i wouldn’t read
anything else, 5) too much vs not enough editorializing, 6) not enough context
Tweet at @evan_van_ness if you have any opinions or reactions to any of those things.
If you’re wondering “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ?”
Week in Ethereum News
